Your sister laughs. “You just stood here and told me all about how exactly you ARE a baby and now you want to claim your not?”

“I’s not.” You insist. “I’s this many.” You blurt out holding up three fingers.

Somewhere in your mind you realize that isn’t the case. You aren’t 3 your 18 but right now you feel 3 and your words don’t want to come out right either. Your excitement in sharing about Mrs. Ross had bubbled over and suddenly you felt something inside you click into place the trigger coming from your sisters words. Later when it’s time for a nap you’ll realize that it had been her calling Mrs. Ross your mommy that had done you in.

You sister seems torn on whether or not to laugh but realizes you aren’t joking. “Ok a toddler then.” She says.

“What’s a tod-ler?” You ask her.

“Uh. A kid whose not a baby but not quite a big girl yet.” She explains a little unsure. “Like you. Someone under 5.”

“I bigger dan five.” Numbers prove to be just as difficult as saying things correctly. Your aware of numbers but aren’t quite sure of their order. You KNOW your three but can’t grasp in your current mindset that any one number is bigger than another.

“Really?” She asks curiously. In an attempt to gauge just where you are mentally she continues “can you count to five?”

“Uh huh!” You say confidently. “One, three, seven, two, five.”

She chuckles. “Not quite Izzy. It’s 1, 2,3,4,5. Can you remember that?”

“Ummmm.” You say uncertain. Your not as confident in your abilities anymore. You were sure that you were correct before but obviously if your sissy is saying it was wrong then maybe not. “Uh Uh.” You decide shaking your head. Numbers are too hard.

“Can you say the alphabet for me?” She asks instead.

Confident again you say “A B C D E F G.” Then you stop. Thinking hard. You start again and get to H before you give up. “I can do it.” You insist.

“I’m sure you can.” Your sissy agrees. “Do you remember the song?” She starts to sing it and you join in. It’s a lot easier with help and before you know it you’ve finished. “Good job!” She praises. You smile with pride.

“Pay now?” You ask her.

“Sure.” She agrees and then you run off onto the jungle Jim.

Eventually Mrs. Ross comes to get you so you can go home. You aren’t too upset about having to leave. Your just happy to be with your caretaker. Mommy. Your mind corrects.
You reach to be picked up when you get to Mr. Ross. It’s been a long morning and think it might be around your nap time. You drift off as Mr. Ross carries you home.
1212121321331311223222221121121113111312.title: Go play

1212121321331311223222221121121113111312.content:
The rest of the weekend passed in a blur of movies and playtime. Your a little sad that you have to go back to school but it’s not like Mrs.Ross won’t be there. Mr. Ross has changed you a few more times during the course of the weekend and you’ve gotten pretty used to it.

The weeks pass essentially the same as the last two days of the first week and before you know it you’ve been living with Mr. and Mrs. Ross for three weeks. You can’t tell when you have to pee or even poop anymore. You only notice when your diaper grows warm if you aren’t already wet or when you sit in your own mess but even then Mr and Mrs Ross are quick to change you.

The biggest change though is that you’ve fallen into your roll deeply now. You are beginning to delight in the childish prints that are on your clothes. The cartoons that you watch before and after school are starting to seem more entertaining and you enjoy the bright colors. You’re also enjoying playing with your toys in your room before bed. You drank more often than not out of a sippy cup unless you were drinking out of a juice box and a pacifier was never far from you.

Your gait was well and truly a baby’s waddle and you’ve even contemplated crawling a few times simply because it seemed easier. Reading seemed too hard these days too so Mr or Mrs Ross often read to you. You always hold someone’s hand when you leave the house and you’ve started feeling safe in your car seat instead of confined. Your vocabulary now suits an older toddler instead of an adult and you’ve developed a bit of a lisp from constantly sucking on a pacifier.

You haven’t been without Mr. or Mrs Ross at all since you’ve started the kindergarten class so it blindsided you when
1212121321331311223222221121121113111312.title: The rest of the weekend

You were busy watching a movie to notice someone entered the house. It was your oldest and best friend, Jennifer. Jennifer spotted you before she went to talk to Mr. and Mrs. Ross. She was confused but after a few minutes of talking with Mrs. Ross in private, Jennifer understood. You were still focused on the movie. It was a very good movie.

“We are off on our dinner date. You behave for your babysitter, okay sweetheart. If you are good then we will go to the toy store tomorrow to get you’re a special toy.” Said Mr. Ross. He ruffled your head and kissed your cheek. Mrs. Ross gave you a hug and kissed your cheek.

You turned to see who your babysitter was. When you saw it was Jennifer, your mouth opened in shock and dropped your pacifier. You did not know what you were going to say.

“Oh no, here.” Said Jennifer as she picked up you pacifier and went and cleaned it in the sink. “Okay, here you go, sugar.” Said Jennifer as she placed the pacifier back into your mouth. “How about a snack and drink?” asked Jennifer.

You nodded your head as you sucked on your pacifier. She picked you up and carried you to the kitchen. You realized that she was nearly six feet tall. Jennifer place you in your highchair. What snack did she fix for you?

We are ready for the picnic.” Said Mrs. Ross. You nodded and waddled to look for Mr. Ross.

You spotted Mr. Ross in his office. You went and tugged on his sleeve. When he looked at you. You gave a big smile. “We are ready to go on a picnic. We are waiting on you. “you said before you stuck your thumb in your mouth. You started to suck on your thumb.


How did you get to the park for the picnic?

You looked around and saw no one was in here. You started to get teary eyed, you need to keep it together. You were an adult not a baby. You kept saying that over and over.

Mrs. Ross rushed into the room. She thought you were hurt. She went over to you and picked you up. She sniffed the air and pulled back your diaper. “Okay, it’s time to get a clean diaper, huh.” Said Mrs. Ross as she set you on the changing table.

The squishing of the mess in your diaper made you cry louder. You squirmed and wiggled trying away from the mess that you made in your diaper. You were still crying just wanting a fresh diaper. There is no way you are going to stay with this woman you just met. You also don't want your relatives to find out about this. That left one option the 24/7 daycare.

"Fine, I will go to daycare. I don't want my relatives seeing me dressed like this and I don't feel comfortable living with you for a while sorry." You said.

When everyone else was gone Ms. Ross easily lifted you up and carried you off to her car. Inside was a carseat. She seriously didn't expect you to ride in that did she? You get your answer soon enough when you find yourself being strapped in. You think of throwing a tantrum saying you are 18 and this is ridiculous but your baby diaper crinkles reminding you what you are wearing all you can do is blush as Ms. Ross drove you to the daycare.
1212121321331312.title: Stay at the daycare

1212122.content:
“Pre-school is the grade you should be. We were so shocked we had to re-check your score. You only got three question right and one was your name.” said the counselor.

The counselor led you to their car and drove you to the pre-school a street down from the school. He held your hand as he led you inside. A tall young woman greeted you. You hid behind the counselor as you were embarrassed about what has happen. “This is the girl I told you about.” Said the counselor.

“Hello I am Miss Bear. I am going to be your friend and caretaker while you are here.” Said Miss Bear as she took your hand and led you to the bathroom.

She removed your pants to see your pull up. “So, you are starting potty training. Good most of our students just started if they had.” Said Miss Bear. Miss Bear check your pull up and it is….

"Good girl for not wetting your pullups!" Beamed Miss Bear before sniffing the air and plugging her nose as she felt the back of the pullup.. "Uh oh didn't someone make a stinky?"

You were absolutely sure you didn't mess your pullup but when she groped the back of your pullup you felt the squishy mes. Standing shocked you couldn't believe you messed your pullup without realizing it!

"It is okay sweetheart!" Miss Bear exclaimed in a sweet voice. "Miss Bear will clean you all up!"

This causes you to look down to see the cartoon prints on the very obvious diaper that clearly fit you perfectly...

A COUPLE OF MONTHS!? YOU ARE SUPPOSE TO BE IN SENIOR YEAR OF HIGH SCHOOL NOT DAYCARE! You thought.

Miss Bear placed you in the playpen. You wanted to throw a tantum but you decided it would just make situation worse. You started to get bored and looked at the toys. info.brief_description: You are 18 years old, life is going pretty well until an accident changes everything.
info.description: Your an 18 year old girl at the beginning of her last year of high school. You are barely 4’ have brown, shoulder length hair, and brown eyes. You aren’t popular but you aren’t picked on either. You have a younger sister who is 13 and a mom who works at a company that sometimes sends her away on business for weeks at a time. Your dad was a lawyer until one of his clients went to his office and shot him to death. Your life is about to change drastically in a very short time.
